item.title: Israeli Soldiers Accused of Using Polymarket to Bet on Strikes
item.description: The country’s internal security agency indicted a reservist and a civilian for security offenses, bribery and obstruction of justice in connection with the bets.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Osipovich

item.title: U.S. Smuggled Thousands of Starlink Terminals Into Iran After Protest Crackdown
item.description: The Trump administration covertly sent terminals into Iran in an effort to keep dissidents online following Tehran’s stifling of internet access.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Gramer

item.title: U.S. Vacates a Key Military Base in Syria
item.description: Al Tanf, long a cornerstone of the fight against Islamic State, has been handed over to the Syrian government as part of a broader drawdown of American troops.
item.dc:creator: Jared Malsin

item.title: Two U.S. Navy Ships Collide in Waters Near South America
item.description: Two people reported injuries after the vessels assigned to the military buildup in the Caribbean collided during a ship-to-ship refueling.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: U.K. Posts Modest Growth for 2025
item.description: The U.K. economy recorded another year of modest economic growth in 2025 as consumers stayed cautious, unemployment rose and borrowing costs remained high.
item.dc:creator: Don Nico Forbes

item.title: U.S. Energy Secretary Talks Oil Revival—and Democracy—in Venezuela Visit
item.description: Chris Wright said “enormous progress” is being made on crude production.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Dubé

item.title: Savior or ‘Supervillain’? A Trump Ally’s Gamble to Unlock Venezuela’s Oil
item.description: Florida energy mogul Harry Sargeant III has been eyeing the country’s reserves for years. He’s on the cusp of the windfall of a lifetime.
item.dc:creator: Alex Leary

item.title: Pentagon Prepares Second Aircraft Carrier to Deploy to the Middle East
item.description: President Trump is ratcheting up the pressure on Iran to make a deal over its nuclear program.

item.title: Accused Canada Shooter an 18-Year-Old Known to Police, Authorities Say

item.title: Opinion | Will Bangladesh’s Elections Produce a ‘Basket Case’?
item.description: The country had made impressive economic progress as its political system turned despotic.

item.title: Violence Surges in Gaza Despite the Cease-Fire

item.title: Canada Mourns Eight Dead in Mass Shooting

item.title: Aboard a NATO Warship as It Practices Hunting Russian Subs
item.description: The alliance is boosting coordination of forces in the Arctic—and members have been dusting off sub-hunting skills that got rusty after the Soviet Union collapsed.

item.title: Opinion | The National Iranian American Council Replies
item.description: NIAC strongly rejects any implication that it is a lobby for the Islamic Republic of Iran.

item.title: U.K. Government Bonds Enter Period of Political Risk
item.description: The rise in yields reflects worries that a successor to Starmer would be tempted to spend more heavily on public services, pushing government debt higher.

item.title: Israeli President’s Visit to Australia Splits the Country

item.title: U.S. Weighs Seizing Tankers Carrying Iranian Oil to Pressure Tehran
item.description: But using the same strategy the White House directed at Venezuela is seen as likely to spark retaliation by Tehran and a surge in oil prices.

item.title: Europe Needs to Learn Its Lesson: Stop Relying on Imported Energy

item.title: Getting a Job Is Harder Than Toppling a Government for Bangladesh’s Gen Z

item.title: China’s Consumer Inflation Eases, Producer Prices Stay in Decline
item.description: China’s consumer inflation softened at the start of 2026 after hitting a near three-year high in December, weighed down by falling food prices.

item.description: The Trump administration put out a new general license authorizing equipment and technology transactions.

item.title: Canada’s Carney Tries to Resolve Trump Demands Over New Bridge

item.description: China has sought to punish Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi for remarks she made about Taiwan, but that strategy has largely backfired.

item.title: Kenya’s Central Bank Cuts Key Lending Rate
item.description: Kenya’s central bank cut its key lending rate as East Africa’s largest economy continued a policy-loosening cycle to boost private-sector lending and economic growth.

item.title: Korean Travel App Aims for 2027 IPO as Tourists Flock to Seoul for Skin Care, K-Pop
item.description: Online travel platform Myrealtrip is seeking a valuation roughly north of $1 billion as K-Pop, K-Beauty and a string of Netflix hits drive a rise in tourism to South Korea.

item.title: Uganda’s Central Bank Holds Key Lending Rate at 9.75%
item.description: Uganda’s central bank maintained its key lending rate at 9.75%, citing rising inflationary pressure and high oil prices amid sustained geopolitical uncertainty.

item.title: Supermajority Gives Japan’s Takaichi Strong Hand at Home and Abroad
